data.name: Wedding: Guests and Tables
data.description:
Your friend Alex invited you to his wedding. He asked you to help him a little bit with the planning: he wants to know how many people there will be per one table, so he distributes dishes and drinks among tables equally. ### Input You will be given a string. You have to focus on two special characters in that string: 1. _'o'_ - denotes a person 2. _'T'_ - denotes a table __Input contains at least one person and at least one table__ Input may or may not contain other characters, they don't have any meaning associated with them therefore shouldn't affect your program's output See Example Test Cases for detailed input examples ### Output You should output an array of three numbers in the following format:
_[people, tables, people_per_tables]_
Where: 1. people - the amount of guests invited to the wedding (they are represented by 'o' in the input) 2. tables - the amount of tables brought to the wedding (they are represented by 'T' in the input) 3. people_per_table - the guest to table ratio rounded to 1 significant digit (it may be 4.2, 1.7, 2.5, etc.) ### Task Complete the __wedding__ function according to the specification given above
